intro: Biporeia, commonly known as the "water scum" or "slime algae," is a genus of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure and the presence of two pores in its reproductive cells, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus. Biporeia thrives in freshwater environments, particularly in shallow, nutrient-rich waters. The plant forms dense mats on the surface of water bodies, contributing to the ecological dynamics of aquatic ecosystems. Its rapid growth and ability to colonize various substrates make it both ecologically significant and sometimes problematic in aquatic management.
